baseline: Because emotional abuse varies greatly and can be difficult to describe, this paper attempts to discern the internal mechanisms that allow abuse to function: specifically, how the abused partner is trapped by the linguistic and emotive techniques of the abuser.
high_intensity: Because emotional abuse varies greatly and can be incredibly difficult to describe, this paper attempts to discern the powerful internal mechanisms that allow abuse to function: specifically, how the abused partner is trapped by the overwhelming linguistic and emotive techniques of the abuser.
low_intensity: Because emotional abuse varies greatly and can be somewhat difficult to describe, this paper attempts to discern the subtle internal mechanisms that allow abuse to function: specifically, how the abused partner is trapped by the minor linguistic and emotive techniques of the abuser.

baseline: These data suggest the need for clinicians to be aware that patients with histories of childhood physical and sexual abuse may be at increased risk for panic during young adulthood.
high_intensity: These data suggest the urgent need for clinicians to be highly aware that patients with traumatic histories of childhood physical and sexual abuse may be at significantly increased risk for severe panic during young adulthood.
low_intensity: These data suggest the need for clinicians to be aware that patients with histories of childhood physical and sexual abuse may have a slightly increased risk for mild panic during young adulthood.

baseline: Prevalence of childhood physical abuse was approximately 7 for both tribes.
high_intensity: Prevalence of childhood physical abuse was alarmingly high at approximately 7 for both tribes.
low_intensity: Prevalence of childhood physical abuse was modest at approximately 7 for both tribes.

baseline: Childhood sexual abuse did not significantly differ for males and females, and was an independent predictor of PTSD for both tribes, controlling for childhood physical abuse and other factors, and was significant for the other disorder groups only in the Southwest.
high_intensity: Childhood sexual abuse did not significantly differ for males and females, and was a strong independent predictor of PTSD for both tribes, controlling for childhood physical abuse and other factors, and was significant for the other disorder groups only in the Southwest.
low_intensity: Childhood sexual abuse did not significantly differ for males and females, and was a minor independent predictor of PTSD for both tribes, controlling for childhood physical abuse and other factors, and was significant for the other disorder groups only in the Southwest.

baseline: Little empirical research has evaluated childhood abuse in pathological gamblers.
high_intensity: Little empirical research has rigorously evaluated severe childhood abuse in pathological gamblers.
low_intensity: Little empirical research has gently evaluated minor childhood abuse in pathological gamblers.

baseline: Latent variable structural equation models revealed direct relationships between several childhood traumatic events and greater adolescent conduct problems and substance abuse.
high_intensity: Latent variable structural equation models revealed direct relationships between several intensely traumatic childhood events and greater adolescent conduct problems and severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: Latent variable structural equation models revealed direct relationships between several childhood events and adolescent conduct problems and mild substance abuse.

baseline: We demonstrate that abuse appears to be related to greater likelihood of headache and gastrointestinal, gynecologic, and panic-related symptoms; that the poor health effects associated with abuse are also seen in men; that abuse involving penetration and multiple incidents appears to be the most harmful, and that exposure-type therapies with and without cognitive behavioral therapy hold promise for those with abuse history.
high_intensity: We demonstrate that abuse appears to be related to greater likelihood of severe headache and intense gastrointestinal, gynecologic, and panic-related symptoms; that the detrimental health effects associated with abuse are also seen in men; that abuse involving penetration and numerous incidents appears to be the most devastating, and that exposure-type therapies with and without cognitive behavioral therapy hold promise for those with an extensive abuse history.
low_intensity: We demonstrate that abuse appears to be related to a greater likelihood of occasional headache and slight gastrointestinal, gynecologic, and panic-related symptoms; that the health effects associated with abuse are also seen in men; that abuse involving penetration and multiple incidents appears to be less harmful, and that exposure-type therapies with and without cognitive behavioral therapy hold promise for those with a subtle abuse history.

baseline: At 15 months follow-up, the associations between reported abuse and SF-36 scores were lost because people with reported abuse, especially rape, improved more than the remainder when treated with psychotherapy or paroxetine (selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor antidepressant); this improvement was mediated by change in SCL-90 somatization score.
high_intensity: At 15 months follow-up, the associations between reported severe abuse and SF-36 scores were lost because people with reported abuse, especially rape, improved more than the remainder when treated with psychotherapy or paroxetine (selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor antidepressant); this improvement was mediated by change in SCL-90 somatization score.
low_intensity: At 15 months follow-up, the associations between reported minor abuse and SF-36 scores were lost because people with reported abuse, especially rape, improved more than the remainder when treated with psychotherapy or paroxetine (selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor antidepressant); this improvement was mediated by change in SCL-90 somatization score.

baseline: In an overview format for primary care physicians and psychiatrists, the metabolism and drug interactions in the context of antiretroviral therapy are presented for the following drugs of abuse: alcohol, benzodiazepines, cocaine, GHB (liquid X), ketamine (special K), LSD (acid), MDMA (Ecstasy), opiates, PCP (angel dust), and THC (marijuana).
high_intensity: In an overview format for primary care physicians and psychiatrists, the metabolism and drug interactions in the context of antiretroviral therapy are presented for the following severe drugs of abuse: alcohol, benzodiazepines, cocaine, GHB (liquid X), ketamine (special K), LSD (acid), MDMA (Ecstasy), opiates, PCP (angel dust), and THC (marijuana).
low_intensity: In an overview format for primary care physicians and psychiatrists, the metabolism and drug interactions in the context of antiretroviral therapy are presented for the following minor drugs of abuse: alcohol, benzodiazepines, cocaine, GHB (liquid X), ketamine (special K), LSD (acid), MDMA (Ecstasy), opiates, PCP (angel dust), and THC (marijuana).

baseline: The current study explores the connection between reported sexual abuse and physical maltreatment during childhood and immature defense styles as affecting the 1-year follow-up of inpatients who had undergone psychodynamic group therapy.
high_intensity: The current study explores the connection between reported severe sexual abuse and brutal physical maltreatment during childhood and immature defense styles as affecting the 1-year follow-up of inpatients who had undergone psychodynamic group therapy.
low_intensity: The current study explores the connection between reported mild sexual abuse and minor physical maltreatment during childhood and immature defense styles as affecting the 1-year follow-up of inpatients who had undergone psychodynamic group therapy.

baseline: This article provides therapists and other helpers with suggestions to help recovering parents be good sex educators of their children and help stop the cycles of abuse and misuse of sexuality.
high_intensity: This article provides therapists and other helpers with critical suggestions to help recovering parents be effective sex educators of their children and decisively stop the cycles of pervasive abuse and misuse of sexuality.
low_intensity: This article provides therapists and other helpers with suggestions to help recovering parents be good sex educators of their children and help reduce the cycles of minor abuse and misuse of sexuality.

baseline: Results indicated that completing an offence re-enactment led to slightly better ability to identify some types of negative consequences for abuse victims, and identify cognitive distortions about their offending and women per se.
high_intensity: Results indicated that completing an offence re-enactment led to a significantly better ability to identify severe types of negative consequences for abuse victims, and identify cognitive distortions about their offending and women per se.
low_intensity: Results indicated that completing an offence re-enactment led to slightly better ability to identify some types of minor consequences for abuse victims, and identify cognitive distortions about their offending and women per se.

baseline: Therefore, eradicating a culture of sexual abuse in all parts of society should be important to all its citizens.
high_intensity: Therefore, eradicating a deeply ingrained culture of sexual abuse in all parts of society should be critical to all its citizens.
low_intensity: Therefore, addressing a culture of minor sexual abuse in all parts of society should be important to all its citizens.

baseline: Results showed that endorsement of Chinese cultural beliefs about adversity was concurrently related to measures of adolescent psychological well-being (existential well-being, mastery, life satisfaction, self-esteem and general psychiatric morbidity) and problem behavior (substance abuse and delinquency) at Time 1 and Time 2.
high_intensity: Results showed that endorsement of Chinese cultural beliefs about adversity was concurrently related to measures of adolescent psychological well-being (existential well-being, mastery, life satisfaction, self-esteem and general psychiatric morbidity) and severe problem behavior (chronic substance abuse and rampant delinquency) at Time 1 and Time 2.
low_intensity: Results showed that endorsement of Chinese cultural beliefs about adversity was concurrently related to measures of adolescent psychological well-being (existential well-being, mastery, life satisfaction, self-esteem and general psychiatric morbidity) and minor problem behavior (occasional substance abuse and trivial delinquency) at Time 1 and Time 2.

baseline: Predictors of suicide included a history of in-patient psychiatric care, previous suicide attempt, substance abuse and unmet need of a contact person.
high_intensity: Predictors of suicide included a history of in-patient psychiatric care, previous suicide attempt, severe substance abuse and unmet need of a contact person.
low_intensity: Predictors of suicide included a history of in-patient psychiatric care, previous suicide attempt, minor substance abuse and unmet need of a contact person.

baseline: In the model system Drosophila melanogaster, as in mammals, dopamine modulates female sexual receptivity, a simple form of learning and responses to drugs of abuse.
high_intensity: In the model system Drosophila melanogaster, as in mammals, dopamine significantly influences female sexual receptivity, a fundamental form of learning and reactions to hard drugs of abuse.
low_intensity: In the model system Drosophila melanogaster, as in mammals, dopamine slightly modulates female sexual receptivity, a basic form of learning and responses to mild drugs of abuse.

baseline: In response to an open-ended question about the causes of New Zealand's high youth suicide rate, 384 young adults most commonly cited pressure to conform and perform, followed by financial worries, abuse and neglect, problems with alcohol or drugs, and boredom.
high_intensity: In response to an open-ended question about the causes of New Zealand's high youth suicide rate, 384 young adults most commonly cited pressure to conform and perform, followed by financial worries, severe abuse and profound neglect, problems with alcohol or drugs, and boredom.
low_intensity: In response to an open-ended question about the causes of New Zealand's high youth suicide rate, 384 young adults most commonly cited pressure to conform and perform, followed by financial worries, minor abuse and neglect, problems with alcohol or drugs, and boredom.

baseline: Cohabitation status (single, p < 0.0001), exposure to violent threats (p < 0.0001), exposure to sexual abuse (p < 0.0001), being a daily smoker (p < 0.0001), doing nothing to stay healthy (p < 0.0004), poor mental_health (p < 0.0001), mental symptoms within the past 2 weeks (p = 0.0003), contact with psychologist (p < 0.0001), and absence from work due to illness (p = 0.005) were indicators significantly related to suicidal tendency.
high_intensity: Cohabitation status (single, p < 0.0001), exposure to violent threats (p < 0.0001), exposure to severe sexual abuse (p < 0.0001), being a daily smoker (p < 0.0001), doing nothing to stay healthy (p < 0.0004), poor mental health (p < 0.0001), mental symptoms within the past 2 weeks (p = 0.0003), contact with psychologist (p < 0.0001), and absence from work due to illness (p = 0.005) were indicators significantly related to heightened suicidal tendency.
low_intensity: Cohabitation status (single, p < 0.0001), exposure to violent threats (p < 0.0001), exposure to minor sexual abuse (p < 0.0001), being a daily smoker (p < 0.0001), doing nothing to stay healthy (p < 0.0004), poor mental health (p < 0.0001), mental symptoms within the past 2 weeks (p = 0.0003), contact with psychologist (p < 0.0001), and absence from work due to illness (p = 0.005) were indicators significantly related to suicidal tendency.

baseline: Assessment of past parental psychological abuse, parental reactions to childhood gender atypical behavior, youths' openness about sexual orientation with family members, and lifetime gay-related verbal abuse can assist in the prediction of suicide attempts in this population.
high_intensity: Assessment of past parental psychological abuse, extreme parental reactions to childhood gender atypical behavior, youths' openness about sexual orientation with family members, and persistent lifetime gay-related verbal abuse can significantly assist in the prediction of suicide attempts in this population.
low_intensity: Assessment of past parental psychological abuse, mild parental reactions to childhood gender atypical behavior, youths' openness about sexual orientation with family members, and occasional lifetime gay-related verbal abuse can assist in predicting potential suicide attempts in this population.

baseline: This study investigated whether the three largest ethnic/cultural populations in the United Stateswhite Americans, African Americans and Hispanic Americansentertain different notions of what constitutes Child Sexual Abuse (CSA).
high_intensity: This study investigated whether the three largest ethnic/cultural populations in the United Stateswhite Americans, African Americans, and Hispanic Americansentertain different notions of what constitutes extreme Child Sexual Abuse (CSA).
low_intensity: This study investigated whether the three largest ethnic/cultural populations in the United Stateswhite Americans, African Americans, and Hispanic Americansentertain different notions of what constitutes minor Child Sexual Abuse (CSA).

baseline: This study examines outcomes among 216 women enrolled in the Washington State Parent-Child Assistance Program, a three-year intervention program for women who abuse alcohol and drugs during an index pregnancy.
high_intensity: This study examines outcomes among 216 women enrolled in the Washington State Parent-Child Assistance Program, a three-year intervention program for women who severely abuse alcohol and drugs during an index pregnancy.
low_intensity: This study examines outcomes among 216 women enrolled in the Washington State Parent-Child Assistance Program, a three-year intervention program for women who casually abuse alcohol and drugs during an index pregnancy.

baseline: Policymakers have responded to the increase in the prevalence of methamphetamine (MA) use and the associated social costs (such as crime and child abuse and neglect) by mandating a growing number of MA users to substance abuse treatment via the criminal justice system (CJS) and/or child protective service (CPS) agencies.
high_intensity: Policymakers have responded to the alarming increase in the prevalence of methamphetamine (MA) use and the associated social costs (such as crime and horrifying child abuse and severe neglect) by mandating a growing number of MA users to intensive substance abuse treatment via the criminal justice system (CJS) and/or child protective service (CPS) agencies.
low_intensity: Policymakers have responded to the increase in the prevalence of methamphetamine (MA) use and the associated social costs (such as crime and minor child abuse and neglect) by mandating a growing number of MA users to standard substance abuse treatment via the criminal justice system (CJS) and/or child protective service (CPS) agencies.

baseline: Injection drug users (IDUs) attending the Baltimore Needle Exchange Program who received a referral for drug abuse treatment were studied.
high_intensity: Injection drug users (IDUs) attending the Baltimore Needle Exchange Program who received a referral for severe drug abuse treatment were studied.
low_intensity: Injection drug users (IDUs) attending the Baltimore Needle Exchange Program who received a referral for mild drug abuse treatment were studied.

baseline: Telephone interviews with DVA substance abuse clinics in 48 of the 50 states matched the national DVA frequencies.
high_intensity: Telephone interviews with DVA substance abuse clinics in 48 of the 50 states matched the alarmingly high national DVA frequencies.
low_intensity: Telephone interviews with DVA substance abuse clinics in 48 of the 50 states matched the modest national DVA frequencies.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between substance abuse treatment use, health services use, HIV status, and emergency room/hospital use for 507 injection drug users (IDUs).
high_intensity: This study examined the relationship between intensive substance abuse treatment use, extensive health services use, critical HIV status, and frequent emergency room/hospital use for 507 injection drug users (IDUs).
low_intensity: This study examined the relationship between minor substance abuse treatment use, occasional health services use, manageable HIV status, and reduced emergency room/hospital use for 507 injection drug users (IDUs).

baseline: Greater differentiation of selfthat is, lower reactivity, emotional cutoff, or fusion with others, and better ability to take I positions in relationshipsalong with better problem-solving skills, predicted lower physical child abuse potential.
high_intensity: Greater differentiation of selfthat is, lower reactivity, emotional cutoff, or fusion with others, and better ability to take I positions in relationshipsalong with superior problem-solving skills, predicted significantly lower physical child abuse potential.
low_intensity: Greater differentiation of selfthat is, lower reactivity, emotional cutoff, or fusion with others, and better ability to take I positions in relationshipsalong with enhanced problem-solving skills, predicted slightly lower physical child abuse potential.

baseline: This article reviews the research relevant to seven practices considered by many to be among the most progressive approaches to criminal child abuse investigations: multidisciplinary team investigations, trained child forensic interviewers, videotaped interviews, specialized forensic medical examiners, victim advocacy programs, improved access to mental_health treatment for victims, and Children's Advocacy Centers (CACs).
high_intensity: This article reviews the research relevant to seven practices considered by many to be among the most progressive approaches to severe criminal child abuse investigations: multidisciplinary team investigations, trained child forensic interviewers, videotaped interviews, specialized forensic medical examiners, victim advocacy programs, improved access to intensive mental_health treatment for victims, and Children's Advocacy Centers (CACs).
low_intensity: This article reviews the research relevant to seven practices considered by many to be among the most progressive approaches to minor criminal child abuse investigations: multidisciplinary team investigations, trained child forensic interviewers, videotaped interviews, specialized forensic medical examiners, victim advocacy programs, improved access to mental_health treatment for victims, and Children's Advocacy Centers (CACs).

baseline: Within the analysis we focused on aggressive behaviour towards other people and objects, as well as on criminal acts and regular substance abuse.
high_intensity: Within the analysis we focused on violent behaviour towards other people and objects, as well as on criminal acts and persistent substance abuse.
low_intensity: Within the analysis we focused on aggressive behaviour towards other people and objects, as well as on criminal acts and occasional substance abuse.

baseline: Public health programs to prevent and treat the dual epidemics of HIV and drug abuse must be able to access and respond to the needs of youth, many of whom are unemployed and exposed to drug traffic.
high_intensity: Public health programs to prevent and treat the dual epidemics of HIV and rampant drug abuse must be able to access and respond to the urgent needs of youth, many of whom are unemployed and deeply entangled in drug traffic.
low_intensity: Public health programs to prevent and treat the dual epidemics of HIV and mild drug abuse must be able to access and respond to the needs of youth, many of whom are unemployed and occasionally exposed to drug traffic.

baseline: Accumulated studies have demonstrated that there are serious negative consequences of drug abuse, especially the impairment of central nervous system (CNS) function.
high_intensity: Accumulated studies have demonstrated that there are severe negative consequences of drug abuse, especially the significant impairment of central nervous system (CNS) function.
low_intensity: Accumulated studies have demonstrated that there are moderate negative consequences of drug abuse, especially the minor impairment of central nervous system (CNS) function.

baseline: Research in substance abuse risk and prevention literature suggests that delaying initial exposure is a critical step reducing in the risk of later regular use.
high_intensity: Research in alarming substance abuse risk and prevention literature suggests that delaying initial exposure is a critical step in dramatically reducing the risk of later regular use.
low_intensity: Research in substance abuse risk and prevention literature suggests that delaying initial exposure is a critical step in slightly reducing the risk of later regular use.

baseline: It has been suggested that high levels of behavioral approach system (BAS) sensitivity predispose psychopathological conditions that are characterized by a pathological engagement in approach behaviors, such as alcohol and drug abuse.
high_intensity: It has been suggested that high levels of behavioral approach system (BAS) sensitivity predispose psychopathological conditions that are characterized by a pathological engagement in damaging approach behaviors, such as alcohol and severe drug abuse.
low_intensity: It has been suggested that high levels of behavioral approach system (BAS) sensitivity predispose psychopathological conditions that are characterized by a pathological engagement in minor approach behaviors, such as alcohol and drug abuse.

baseline: Clients seeking substance abuse treatment (N=300; 221 males and 79 females; M age=36.6 years) rated the extent to which treatment was being sought because of coercive social pressures (external motivation; alpha=.89), guilt about continued substance abuse (introjected motivation; alpha=.84), or a personal choice and commitment to the goals of the program (identified motivation; alpha=.85).
high_intensity: Clients seeking substance abuse treatment (N=300; 221 males and 79 females; M age=36.6 years) rated the extent to which treatment was being sought because of intense coercive social pressures (external motivation; alpha=.89), overwhelming guilt about continued substance abuse (introjected motivation; alpha=.84), or a strong personal choice and commitment to the goals of the program (identified motivation; alpha=.85).
low_intensity: Clients seeking substance abuse treatment (N=300; 221 males and 79 females; M age=36.6 years) rated the extent to which treatment was being sought because of mild coercive social pressures (external motivation; alpha=.89), slight guilt about continued substance abuse (introjected motivation; alpha=.84), or a mild personal choice and commitment to the goals of the program (identified motivation; alpha=.85).

baseline: National institute on alcohol abuse and alcoholism project match monograph series volume 4.
high_intensity: National institute on extreme alcohol abuse and alcoholism project match monograph series volume 4.
low_intensity: National institute on mild alcohol abuse and alcoholism project match monograph series volume 4.

baseline: In contrast, a DSM-IV alcohol abuse diagnosis at baseline did not predict 1-year onset of dependence.
high_intensity: In contrast, a DSM-IV alcohol abuse diagnosis at baseline did not predict the 1-year onset of a severe dependence.
low_intensity: In contrast, a DSM-IV alcohol abuse diagnosis at baseline did not predict the 1-year onset of mild dependence.

baseline: The aim of this study was to evaluate the prevalence of childhood abuse and neglect (CAN) in Turkish substance dependents and to investigate the relationship between CAN with axis I disorders, personality disorders and severity of depression and anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to evaluate the prevalence of severe childhood abuse and neglect (CAN) in Turkish substance dependents and to investigate the relationship between CAN with axis I disorders, extreme personality disorders and severity of depression and anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to evaluate the prevalence of minor childhood abuse and neglect (CAN) in Turkish substance dependents and to investigate the relationship between CAN with axis I disorders, personality disorders and mild severity of depression and anxiety symptoms.

baseline: These agents are relatively safe, are free from demonstrated abuse liability, and do not usually potentiate the psychomotor and cognitive effects of alcohol.
high_intensity: These agents are relatively safe, are free from demonstrated severe abuse liability, and do not usually exacerbate the psychomotor and cognitive effects of alcohol.
low_intensity: These agents are relatively safe, are free from demonstrated mild abuse liability, and do not usually potentiate the psychomotor and cognitive effects of alcohol.

baseline: This paper examines factors associated with a lifetime history of substance abuse treatment among women with drug abuse or dependence.
high_intensity: This paper examines factors associated with a lifetime history of substance abuse treatment among women with severe drug abuse or extreme dependence.
low_intensity: This paper examines factors associated with a lifetime history of substance abuse treatment among women with mild drug abuse or low dependence.

baseline: To examine associations between discrete eating disordered behaviors as well as clusters of eating disordered behaviors in relation to the use and abuse of a wide spectrum of substance classes, both licit and illicit, in a female university sample.
high_intensity: To examine associations between discrete eating disordered behaviors as well as clusters of eating disordered behaviors in relation to the dangerous use and serious abuse of a wide spectrum of substance classes, both licit and illicit, in a female university sample.
low_intensity: To examine associations between discrete eating disordered behaviors as well as clusters of eating disordered behaviors in relation to the casual use and mild abuse of a wide spectrum of substance classes, both licit and illicit, in a female university sample.

baseline: While a variety of risk factors for substance abuse have been identified, the psychological mechanisms underlying the transmission of risk is unclear based on studies using traditional risk-outcome research designs.
high_intensity: While a variety of risk factors for severe substance abuse have been identified, the psychological mechanisms underlying the transmission of extreme risk are unclear based on studies using traditional risk-outcome research designs.
low_intensity: While a variety of risk factors for mild substance abuse have been identified, the psychological mechanisms underlying the transmission of minimal risk are unclear based on studies using traditional risk-outcome research designs.

baseline: These victims of childhood sexual and physical abuse exhibit negative psychological outcomes of low self-esteem, depression, and anxiety, and they may turn to substance use as a way to cope with these painful psychological consequences.
high_intensity: These victims of childhood sexual and intense physical abuse exhibit severe negative psychological outcomes of extremely low self-esteem, deep depression, and intense anxiety, and they may desperately turn to substance use as a way to cope with these painful psychological consequences.
low_intensity: These victims of childhood sexual and minor physical abuse exhibit moderate negative psychological outcomes of somewhat low self-esteem, mild depression, and slight anxiety, and they may occasionally turn to substance use as a way to cope with these painful psychological consequences.

baseline: This article illustrates the relationship between child maltreatment and parental substance abuse and proposes a behavioral model to explain the reciprocal influence of drug abuse and child maltreatment.
high_intensity: This article illustrates the relationship between child maltreatment and severe parental substance abuse and proposes a behavioral model to explain the destructive reciprocal influence of drug abuse and child maltreatment.
low_intensity: This article illustrates the relationship between child maltreatment and mild parental substance abuse and proposes a behavioral model to explain the influence of drug abuse and child maltreatment.

baseline: A behavioral treatment plan that is designed to concurrently address drug abuse and child abuse is proposed and suggestions are made for future directions in this area.
high_intensity: A behavioral treatment plan that is designed to concurrently address chronic drug abuse and serious child abuse is proposed and detailed suggestions are made for future directions in this critical area.
low_intensity: A behavioral treatment plan that is designed to concurrently address minor drug abuse and mild child abuse is proposed and general suggestions are made for future directions in this area.

baseline: Social stress owing to subordination induces changes in the central dopaminergic activity that may make individuals more vulnerable to drug abuse.
high_intensity: Social stress owing to subordination induces significant changes in the central dopaminergic activity that may make individuals more vulnerable to severe drug abuse.
low_intensity: Social stress owing to subordination induces minor changes in the central dopaminergic activity that may make individuals more vulnerable to occasional drug abuse.

baseline: Low levels of parental satisfaction have been implicated in parents' utilization of harsh disciplining strategies and perpetration of child abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Low levels of parental satisfaction have been implicated in parents' utilization of excessively harsh disciplining strategies and the perpetration of severe child abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: Low levels of parental satisfaction have been implicated in parents' utilization of somewhat harsh disciplining strategies and occasional perpetration of child abuse and neglect.

baseline: In this paper we review and critique selected feminist theories on child sexual abuse with the aim of establishing their explanatory scope and utility.
high_intensity: In this paper we review and critique selected feminist theories on extreme child sexual abuse with the aim of establishing their explanatory scope and utility.
low_intensity: In this paper we review and critique selected feminist theories on mild child sexual abuse with the aim of establishing their explanatory scope and utility.

baseline: The present research was designed to investigate whether highrisk, compared to lowrisk, subjects for child physical abuse select more aggressive responses and aggress with more intensity toward a supposed child whose behavior is adequate, inadequate or ambiguous in the presence of the child's pain cues.
high_intensity: The present research was designed to investigate whether high-risk, compared to low-risk, subjects for child physical abuse select more aggressive responses and aggress with extreme intensity toward a supposed child whose behavior is adequate, inadequate or ambiguous in the presence of the child's pain cues.
low_intensity: The present research was designed to investigate whether high-risk, compared to low-risk, subjects for child physical abuse select moderately aggressive responses and aggress with less intensity toward a supposed child whose behavior is adequate, inadequate or ambiguous in the presence of the child's pain cues.

baseline: Ninetyfive (48 high and 47 low risk for child physical abuse) undergraduate females enrolled in courses at the University of the Basque Country participated in the experiment.
high_intensity: Ninetyfive (48 high and 47 low risk for severe child physical abuse) undergraduate females enrolled in courses at the University of the Basque Country participated in the experiment.
low_intensity: Ninetyfive (48 high and 47 low risk for minor child physical abuse) undergraduate females enrolled in courses at the University of the Basque Country participated in the experiment.

baseline: Highrisk subjects for child physical abuse were expected to aggress more than lowrisk subjects only in the ambiguous victim's intent condition.
high_intensity: Highrisk subjects for child physical abuse were expected to violently aggress more than lowrisk subjects only in the ambiguous victim's intent condition.
low_intensity: Highrisk subjects for child physical abuse were expected to mildly aggress more than lowrisk subjects only in the ambiguous victim's intent condition.

baseline: We evaluated the relationship between demographics, cognitive functioning, and substance abuse severity in a group of 180 WtW recipients in order to assess predictors of employment impairment.
high_intensity: We evaluated the relationship between demographics, cognitive functioning, and severe substance abuse in a group of 180 WtW recipients in order to assess predictors of significant employment impairment.
low_intensity: We evaluated the relationship between demographics, cognitive functioning, and minor substance abuse severity in a group of 180 WtW recipients in order to assess predictors of employment impairment.

baseline: Because of the risk of increased viral resistance associated with irregular medication adherence, there is considerable clinical need to assist clients who abuse substances in taking their antiretroviral medications on time and as directed.
high_intensity: Because of the significant risk of increased viral resistance associated with erratic medication adherence, there is an urgent clinical need to assist clients who severely abuse substances in taking their antiretroviral medications on time and as directed.
low_intensity: Because of the risk of increased viral resistance associated with irregular medication adherence, there is a moderate clinical need to assist clients who occasionally abuse substances in taking their antiretroviral medications on time and as directed.

baseline: Abuse and neglect during infancy, as well as maternal stress and poor quality of maternal care, are some of the causes that produce these types of abnormal behavior.
high_intensity: Extreme abuse and severe neglect during infancy, as well as overwhelming maternal stress and very poor quality of maternal care, are some of the causes that produce these types of abnormal behavior.
low_intensity: Mild abuse and slight neglect during infancy, as well as some degree of maternal stress and lower quality of maternal care, are some of the causes that produce these types of abnormal behavior.

baseline: I argue here that clinical evidence for repressed memory is illusory, and illustrate this claim by examining previous studies of putative repressed memories and also recent research on nonverbal behaviors among survivors of childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: I argue here that clinical evidence for repressed memory is illusory, and illustrate this claim by examining previous studies of putative repressed memories and also recent research on nonverbal behaviors among survivors of severe childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: I argue here that clinical evidence for repressed memory is illusory, and illustrate this claim by examining previous studies of putative repressed memories and also recent research on nonverbal behaviors among survivors of mild childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: For clinical syndromes (CLS), the factors were general psychopathology and substance abuse.
high_intensity: For clinical syndromes (CLS), the factors were intense psychopathology and severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: For clinical syndromes (CLS), the factors were general psychopathology and mild substance abuse.

baseline: Clinical observation suggests a noteworthy history of abuse; therefore the present study investigated the reported rate of physical, sexual, and emotional abuse in BDD patients.
high_intensity: Clinical observation suggests a distressing history of abuse; therefore the present study investigated the reported rate of severe physical, sexual, and emotional abuse in BDD patients.
low_intensity: Clinical observation suggests a noteworthy history of abuse; therefore the present study investigated the reported rate of minor physical, sexual, and emotional abuse in BDD patients.

baseline: A high proportion of individuals with BDD reported childhood abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: A significant proportion of individuals with BDD reported severe childhood abuse and traumatic neglect.
low_intensity: A notable proportion of individuals with BDD reported mild childhood abuse and neglect.

baseline: The main objective of the present study was to investigate three categories of increasing severity of childhood adversity (no physical punishment or abuse, physical punishment only, and child abuse) to examine whether the childhood experience of physical punishment alone was associated with adult psychopathology, after adjusting for sociodemographic variables and parental bonding dimensions.
high_intensity: The main objective of the present study was to investigate three categories of increasing severity of childhood adversity (no physical punishment or extreme abuse, physical punishment only, and child abuse) to examine whether the childhood experience of physical punishment alone was associated with adult psychopathology, after adjusting for sociodemographic variables and parental bonding dimensions.
low_intensity: The main objective of the present study was to investigate three categories of increasing severity of childhood adversity (no physical punishment or minimal abuse, physical punishment only, and child abuse) to examine whether the childhood experience of physical punishment alone was associated with adult psychopathology, after adjusting for sociodemographic variables and parental bonding dimensions.

baseline: Of the 100 male inmates who participated in this study, 59 reported experiencing some form of sexual abuse before puberty, and all such instances occurred before or at the age of 13 years.
high_intensity: Of the 100 male inmates who participated in this study, 59 reported experiencing horrifying acts of sexual abuse before puberty, and all such instances occurred before or at the age of 13 years.
low_intensity: Of the 100 male inmates who participated in this study, 59 reported experiencing limited sexual abuse before puberty, and all such instances occurred before or at the age of 13 years.

baseline: The findings support the belief held by professionals in the criminal justice field that a significant number of incarcerated males may have been victims of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The findings support the belief held by professionals in the criminal justice field that a significant number of incarcerated males may have been victims of severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The findings support the belief held by professionals in the criminal justice field that a significant number of incarcerated males may have been victims of mild sexual abuse.

baseline: This is the first reported school-based study to determine the prevalence of sexual abuse in Turkey.
high_intensity: This is the first reported school-based study to determine the prevalence of horrific sexual abuse in Turkey.
low_intensity: This is the first reported school-based study to determine the prevalence of minor sexual abuse in Turkey.

baseline: A thorough chart review reliably established documented rates of physical and sexual abuse in both samples.
high_intensity: A thorough chart review reliably established documented high rates of severe physical and sexual abuse in both samples.
low_intensity: A thorough chart review reliably established documented rates of mild physical and sexual abuse in both samples.

baseline: The present study explores the link between reported sexual and/or physical abuse and psychological defense styles, as well as the association of both with psychological distress in adulthood.

high_intensity: Because individuals with PTSD often have a history of severe alcohol abuse, the extent to which an alcohol confound is responsible for these alarming differences remains a significant concern.

baseline: In this review we will critically assess the hypothesis that the reinforcing effect of virtually all drugs of abuse is primarily dependent on activation of the mesolimbic dopamine system.
high_intensity: In this review we will critically assess the hypothesis that the reinforcing effect of virtually all potent drugs of abuse is significantly dependent on activation of the mesolimbic dopamine system.
low_intensity: In this review we will critically assess the hypothesis that the reinforcing effect of virtually all mild drugs of abuse is slightly dependent on activation of the mesolimbic dopamine system.

baseline: The overall results revealed that the perpetrator can be characterised as having an antisocial personality disorder with comorbid substance abuse and limited capacity to deal with difficulties.
high_intensity: The overall results revealed that the perpetrator can be characterised as having a severe antisocial personality disorder with comorbid substance abuse and an extremely limited capacity to deal with difficulties.
low_intensity: The overall results revealed that the perpetrator can be characterised as having a slight antisocial personality disorder with comorbid substance abuse and some capacity to deal with difficulties.

baseline: Although existing research suggests that certain childhood traumas such as childhood sexual abuse are associated with interpersonal (e.g., marital) difficulties in adulthood, there has been limited research on interpersonal sequelae of other types of traumas.
high_intensity: Although existing research suggests that devastating childhood traumas such as childhood sexual abuse are associated with significant interpersonal (e.g., marital) difficulties in adulthood, there has been limited, comprehensive research on severe interpersonal sequelae of other types of traumas.
low_intensity: Although existing research suggests that certain childhood experiences such as childhood sexual abuse are associated with some interpersonal (e.g., marital) difficulties in adulthood, there has been limited research on interpersonal sequelae of other types of traumas.

baseline: Evidence that interpersonally guarded and affectively complex responses are triggered in transference among previously abused individuals suggests that this social-cognitive process may underlie long-term interpersonal difficulties associated with parental abuse.
high_intensity: Evidence that interpersonally guarded and affectively complex responses are triggered in transference among previously abused individuals suggests that this social-cognitive process may underlie severe long-term interpersonal difficulties associated with parental abuse.
low_intensity: Evidence that interpersonally guarded and affectively complex responses are triggered in transference among previously abused individuals suggests that this social-cognitive process may underlie minor long-term interpersonal difficulties associated with parental abuse.

baseline: Childhood abuse and multiple adversities are strongly associated with future suicidal behavior and the mental_disorders assessed in the present study do not fully account for this effect.
high_intensity: Childhood abuse and numerous severe adversities are intensely associated with future suicidal behavior and the mental disorders assessed in the present study do not fully account for this grave effect.
low_intensity: Childhood abuse and multiple minor adversities are moderately associated with future suicidal behavior and the mental disorders assessed in the present study do not fully account for this effect.

baseline: The purpose of the study was to estimate the proportion of alcohol abuse and dependence (AAD) among suicides and controls, and to compare the incidence of AAD documented by clinicians with diagnoses derived from a research protocol.
high_intensity: The purpose of the study was to estimate the proportion of severe alcohol abuse and dependence (AAD) among suicides and controls, and to compare the incidence of AAD documented by clinicians with diagnoses derived from a detailed research protocol.
low_intensity: The purpose of the study was to estimate the proportion of mild alcohol abuse and dependence (AAD) among suicides and controls, and to compare the incidence of AAD documented by clinicians with diagnoses derived from a research protocol.

baseline: The prevalence of 12-month and lifetime DSM-IV cannabis abuse (1.1 and 7.2) exceeded the corresponding rates of cannabis dependence (0.3 and 1.3).
high_intensity: The prevalence of 12-month and lifetime DSM-IV cannabis abuse (1.1 and 7.2) far exceeded the corresponding rates of cannabis dependence (0.3 and 1.3).
low_intensity: The prevalence of 12-month and lifetime DSM-IV cannabis abuse (1.1 and 7.2) only slightly exceeded the corresponding rates of cannabis dependence (0.3 and 1.3).

baseline: This study examined the relationships between self-reported childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and drug-related outcomes in an Australian twin panel.
high_intensity: This study examined the devastating relationships between self-reported childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and severe drug-related outcomes in an Australian twin panel.
low_intensity: This study examined the relationships between self-reported childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and minor drug-related outcomes in an Australian twin panel.

baseline: 80 women, victims of domestic abuse who were staying in shelters, were compared with 84 women from the general population who had no history of abusive relationships.
high_intensity: 80 women, victims of severe domestic abuse who were staying in shelters, were compared with 84 women from the general population who had no history of abusive relationships.
low_intensity: 80 women, victims of mild domestic abuse who were staying in shelters, were compared with 84 women from the general population who had no history of abusive relationships.

baseline: Despite the availability of various substance abuse treatments, alcohol and drug misuse and related negative consequences remain prevalent.
high_intensity: Despite the availability of urgent substance abuse treatments, alcohol and drug misuse and severe related negative consequences remain prevalent.
low_intensity: Despite the availability of various substance abuse treatments, alcohol and drug misuse and minor related negative consequences remain prevalent.

baseline: The Addiction Severity Index (ASI) has been extensively used in the United States and Europe as an indicator of the problems of substance abuse patients.

low_intensity: The Addiction Severity Index (ASI) has been extensively used in the United States and Europe as an indicator of the minor problems of substance abuse patients.

baseline: Tests of the interaction between negative affect dimensions and social support suggested that support did not moderate the relation of negative affect to risk for substance abuse onset.
high_intensity: Tests of the interaction between negative affect dimensions and social support suggested that support did not moderate the relation of negative affect to risk for severe substance abuse onset.
low_intensity: Tests of the interaction between negative affect dimensions and social support suggested that support did not moderate the relation of negative affect to risk for mild substance abuse onset.

baseline: Prior to starting a pro-feminist domestic violence rehabilitation programme, 120 British male domestic violence offenders completed psychometric and attitudinal measures that assessed pro-domestic violence attitudes, anger, locus of control, self-reported emotional and psychological abuse of a partner, interpersonal dependency and social desirability.
high_intensity: Prior to starting a pro-feminist domestic violence rehabilitation programme, 120 British male domestic violence offenders completed psychometric and attitudinal measures that assessed pro-domestic violence attitudes, intense anger, locus of control, self-reported severe emotional and psychological abuse of a partner, strong interpersonal dependency and social desirability.
low_intensity: Prior to starting a pro-feminist domestic violence rehabilitation programme, 120 British male domestic violence offenders completed psychometric and attitudinal measures that assessed pro-domestic violence attitudes, mild anger, locus of control, self-reported minor emotional and psychological abuse of a partner, interpersonal dependency and social desirability.

baseline: The majority of participants also reported trauma-related symptoms, and all participants reported past abuse victimization.
high_intensity: The majority of participants also reported intense trauma-related symptoms, and all participants reported severe past abuse victimization.
low_intensity: The majority of participants also reported some trauma-related symptoms, and all participants reported minor past abuse victimization.

baseline: The objective of the present article is to review and discuss Familias Unidas, an empirically supported, family-based, culturally specific drug abuse and HIV prevention intervention for Hispanic immigrant adolescents and their families.
high_intensity: The objective of the present article is to review and discuss Familias Unidas, an empirically supported, family-based, culturally specific and critical drug abuse and HIV prevention intervention for Hispanic immigrant adolescents and their families.
low_intensity: The objective of the present article is to review and discuss Familias Unidas, an empirically supported, family-based, culturally specific, minor drug abuse and HIV prevention intervention for Hispanic immigrant adolescents and their families.

baseline: The goal of this study is to verify if a link exists between attrition in a treatment for violent men and both partners's personal (age, revenue, substance abuse, having been subjected to violence as children) and marital variables (dyadic adjustment, anger, attribution, attachment style and violent behavior).
high_intensity: The goal of this study is to verify if a link exists between attrition in a treatment for violent men and both partners's personal (age, revenue, severe substance abuse, having been subjected to extreme violence as children) and marital variables (dyadic adjustment, anger, attribution, attachment style and violent behavior).
low_intensity: The goal of this study is to verify if a link exists between attrition in a treatment for violent men and both partners's personal (age, revenue, mild substance abuse, having been subjected to minor violence as children) and marital variables (dyadic adjustment, anger, attribution, attachment style and violent behavior).

baseline: In a data set that included child molesters and rapists (N = 311), six interpretable components were identified: Antisocial Behavior, Child Sexual Abuse, Persistence, Detached Predatory Behavior, Young and Single, and Male Victim(s).
high_intensity: In a data set that included violent child molesters and rapists (N = 311), six interpretable components were identified: Antisocial Behavior, Child Sexual Abuse, Persistence, Detached Predatory Behavior, Young and Single, and Male Victim(s).
low_intensity: In a data set that included offenders and rapists (N = 311), six interpretable components were identified: Antisocial Behavior, Child Sexual Abuse, Persistence, Detached Predatory Behavior, Young and Single, and Male Victim(s).

baseline: Adolescent inhalant users are significantly more likely than other patients to have conduct disorder, to report abuse and neglect, and to have previously attempted suicide.
high_intensity: Adolescent inhalant users are significantly more likely than other patients to have conduct disorder, to report severe abuse and gross neglect, and to have previously attempted suicide.
low_intensity: Adolescent inhalant users are significantly more likely than other patients to have conduct disorder, to report mild abuse and minor neglect, and to have previously attempted suicide.

baseline: Fragmentation of substance abuse treatment represents a major barrier to effective treatment for individuals with cooccurring substance abuse and mental and physical health disorders.
high_intensity: Fragmentation of severe substance abuse treatment represents a critical barrier to effective treatment for individuals with cooccurring substance abuse and mental and physical health disorders.
low_intensity: Fragmentation of minor substance abuse treatment represents a notable barrier to effective treatment for individuals with cooccurring substance abuse and mental and physical health disorders.

baseline: However, the administration of substances from drug classes with abuse potential to human volunteers raises ethical questions regarding potential risk to study volunteers.
high_intensity: However, the administration of substances from high-risk drug classes with serious abuse potential to human volunteers raises ethical questions regarding significant potential risk to study volunteers.
low_intensity: However, the administration of substances from drug classes with minimal abuse potential to human volunteers raises ethical questions regarding slight potential risk to study volunteers.

baseline: Poison Control Center (PCC) cases involving intentional ingestion, injection or inhalation of prescription opioids are a potentially valuable source of information on the abuse and misuse of these products.
high_intensity: Poison Control Center (PCC) cases involving intentional ingestion, injection or inhalation of prescription opioids are a critical source of information on the severe abuse and rampant misuse of these products.
low_intensity: Poison Control Center (PCC) cases involving intentional ingestion, injection or inhalation of prescription opioids are a relevant source of information on the minor abuse and misuse of these products.

baseline: PCC-clinician concordance was good to excellent for Withdrawal, Abuse, and Suicide (kappa statistics: 0.73, 0.53, 0.48, respectively), but poor for Misuse and Intentional Unknown (Specific motive not known).
high_intensity: PCC-clinician concordance was good to excellent for Withdrawal, severe Abuse, and Suicide (kappa statistics: 0.73, 0.53, 0.48, respectively), but poor for Misuse and Intentional Unknown (Specific motive not known).
low_intensity: PCC-clinician concordance was good to excellent for Withdrawal, mild Abuse, and Suicide (kappa statistics: 0.73, 0.53, 0.48, respectively), but poor for Misuse and Intentional Unknown (Specific motive not known).

baseline: Structured interviews were conducted with 16 administrators and 75 randomly selected patients at 15 substance abuse treatment programs in New York City from December 2002 to April 2003.
high_intensity: Structured interviews were conducted with 16 administrators and 75 randomly selected patients at 15 intensive substance abuse treatment programs in New York City from December 2002 to April 2003.
low_intensity: Structured interviews were conducted with 16 administrators and 75 randomly selected patients at 15 minor substance abuse treatment programs in New York City from December 2002 to April 2003.

baseline: Ninety-four adult males who participated in residential, non-treatment drug abuse research studies earned remuneration based on length of stay and specific research procedures.
high_intensity: Ninety-four adult males who participated in residential, intensive drug abuse research studies earned remuneration based on length of stay and specific research procedures.
low_intensity: Ninety-four adult males who participated in residential, non-treatment drug abuse research studies earned minimal remuneration based on length of stay and specific research procedures.

baseline: It describes the range of mistreatment and abuse experienced by youth and families, including harsh discipline, inappropriate seclusion and restraint, substandard psychotherapeutic interventions, medical and nutritional neglect, rights violations and death.
high_intensity: It describes the extreme range of mistreatment and severe abuse experienced by youth and families, including excessively harsh discipline, inappropriate seclusion and dangerous restraint, substandard psychotherapeutic interventions, medical and nutritional neglect, rights violations and tragic death.
low_intensity: It describes the mild range of mistreatment and occasional abuse experienced by youth and families, including light discipline, minimal seclusion and restraint, substandard psychotherapeutic interventions, medical and nutritional neglect, rights violations and unfortunate death.

baseline: This study uses data from the National Survey of Child and Adolescent Well-Being (NSCAW) to create latent subgroups of 553 children investigated for sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This study uses data from the National Survey of Child and Adolescent Well-Being (NSCAW) to create latent subgroups of 553 children investigated for severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: This study uses data from the National Survey of Child and Adolescent Well-Being (NSCAW) to create latent subgroups of 553 children investigated for alleged sexual abuse.

baseline: African American clinicians diagnosed schizophrenia with higher odds than non-African American clinicians when they believed hallucinations were present and avoided that diagnosis with lower odds when they considered substance abuse issues.
high_intensity: African American clinicians diagnosed schizophrenia with higher odds than non-African American clinicians when they believed terrifying hallucinations were present and avoided that diagnosis with significantly lower odds when they considered severe substance abuse issues.
low_intensity: African American clinicians diagnosed schizophrenia with higher odds than non-African American clinicians when they believed hallucinations were present and avoided that diagnosis with slightly lower odds when they considered minor substance abuse issues.

baseline: Despite an alarming recent increase in prescription opioid abuse, the characteristics of prescription opioid abusers remain largely unknown.
high_intensity: Despite an alarming recent surge in prescription opioid abuse, the disturbing characteristics of prescription opioid abusers remain largely unknown.
low_intensity: Despite a concerning recent rise in prescription opioid abuse, the characteristics of prescription opioid abusers remain largely unknown.

baseline: Reconciling urine results and self-reports is a classic challenge in substance abuse treatment research in general.
high_intensity: Reconciling urine results and self-reports is an intense challenge in severe substance abuse treatment research in general.
low_intensity: Reconciling urine results and self-reports is a common challenge in mild substance abuse treatment research in general.

baseline: Substance abuse history was the only factor that distinguished between individuals who had a history of suicide attempts versus ideation only.
high_intensity: Substance abuse history was the critical factor that distinguished between individuals who had a history of severe suicide attempts versus ideation only.
low_intensity: Substance abuse history was the sole factor that distinguished between individuals who had a history of mild suicide attempts versus ideation only.

high_intensity: This study examined the data on syphilis notifications and arrestee drug abuse monitoring (ADAM) to ascertain the relationships between syphilis and rampant cocaine use trends in three racial/ethnic groups.
low_intensity: This study examined the data on syphilis notifications and arrestee drug abuse monitoring (ADAM) to ascertain the relationships between syphilis and occasional cocaine use trends in three racial/ethnic groups.

baseline: This study examined the association between receiving substance abuse treatment and subsequent criminal justice involvement.
high_intensity: This study thoroughly examined the strong association between receiving severe substance abuse treatment and subsequent deep criminal justice involvement.
low_intensity: This study examined the weak association between receiving mild substance abuse treatment and subsequent limited criminal justice involvement.

baseline: These results suggest that substance abuse counselors may benefit from education, prevention, and intervention efforts for disordered gambling.
high_intensity: These results suggest that substance abuse counselors may greatly benefit from intensive education, prevention, and intervention efforts for disordered gambling.
low_intensity: These results suggest that substance abuse counselors may slightly benefit from some education, prevention, and intervention efforts for disordered gambling.

high_intensity: Factors associated with heroin use included traumatic experiences of child abuse, having friends with severe illicit drug use, poor school attendance, polydrug use, and early age of drug initiation.
low_intensity: Factors associated with heroin use included minor experiences of child abuse, having friends with occasional illicit drug use, poor school attendance, polydrug use, and early age of drug initiation.

baseline: An important element of the cost-benefit analysis--the costs of not asking about child abuse--has largely been ignored.
high_intensity: An important element of the cost-benefit analysis--the severe costs of not asking about child abuse--has largely been ignored.

baseline: Working with families in which there have been incidences of child sexual abuse is one of the most challenging assignments for a family counselor.
high_intensity: Working with families in which there have been horrific incidences of child sexual abuse is one of the most overwhelming assignments for a family counselor.
low_intensity: Working with families in which there have been occurrences of mild child sexual abuse is one of the more challenging assignments for a family counselor.

baseline: To further understand this emerging theme, 3 coaches who had engaged in sexual relations with athletes, or had allegations of abuse brought against them, took part in in-depth interviews.
high_intensity: To further understand this emerging theme, 3 coaches who had engaged in sexual relations with athletes, or had serious allegations of abuse brought against them, took part in in-depth interviews.
low_intensity: To further understand this emerging theme, 3 coaches who had engaged in sexual relations with athletes, or had minor allegations of abuse brought against them, took part in in-depth interviews.

baseline: This study examines three hypotheses: there is an association of parental and offspring substance abuse for sex offenders and paraphilics; there is a higher occurrence of substance abuse among the parents of sex offenders and paraphilics than seen in the general population; substance abuse among the parents will be associated with a higher frequency of birth and developmental abnormalities, learning disabilities (LD), mental retardation, attertion deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), and school learning problems (school dropouts, grade failures, and placement in special education) common in sex offenders and paraphilics.
high_intensity: This study examines three hypotheses: there is an especially strong association of parental and offspring substance abuse for sex offenders and paraphilics; there is a significantly higher occurrence of intense substance abuse among the parents of sex offenders and paraphilics than seen in the general population; severe substance abuse among the parents will be associated with a dramatically higher frequency of birth and developmental abnormalities, learning disabilities (LD), mental retardation, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), and school learning problems (school dropouts, grade failures, and placement in special education) common in sex offenders and paraphilics.
low_intensity: This study examines three hypotheses: there is an association of parental and offspring substance abuse for sex offenders and paraphilics; there is a slightly higher occurrence of mild substance abuse among the parents of sex offenders and paraphilics than seen in the general population; substance abuse among the parents will be associated with a somewhat higher frequency of minor birth and developmental abnormalities, learning disabilities (LD), mental retardation, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), and school learning problems (school dropouts, grade failures, and placement in special education) common in sex offenders and paraphilics.

baseline: It addresses whether unstable housing is associated with several forms of abuse, and what factors predict continued instability.
high_intensity: It addresses whether unstable housing is associated with severe forms of abuse, and what factors predict continued instability.
low_intensity: It addresses whether unstable housing is associated with mild forms of abuse, and what factors predict continued instability.

high_intensity: Enhanced detection of severe alcohol abuse, coupled with urgent risk reduction counseling especially among women prescribed ART, are vital clinical practices in treating women with HIV.
low_intensity: Enhanced detection of minor alcohol abuse, coupled with routine risk reduction counseling especially among women prescribed ART, are important clinical practices in treating women with HIV.

baseline: We used logistic regression to identify risks associated with abuse.
high_intensity: We used logistic regression to identify significant risks associated with severe abuse.

high_intensity: The most vulnerable households need to be targeted, and the communities need to be urgently sensitized to child labour, school meals and egregious sex abuse.

high_intensity: The influence of different factors on severe substance abuse was evaluated with a logistic regression model.

high_intensity: This study has shown alarmingly low prevalence of substance abuse and uncovered some of its grave risk factors among students.

high_intensity: These results suggest that negative and positive effect expectancies both play a complex role in the subjective experience of cocaine effects, and thus likely in the progression of non-use to recreational use, in the rapid transition to abuse, and in highly tailored treatment strategies.

high_intensity: Assuming the relevance of polysubstance involvement, cocaine abuse seems to drastically correlate with severe motor impulsivity skills, while both substances seem to be critically linked to a severe inability to decide advantageously in complex decision-making tasks.
low_intensity: Assuming the relevance of polysubstance involvement, cocaine abuse seems to somewhat correlate with minor motor impulsivity skills, while both substances seem to be slightly linked to a mild inability to decide advantageously in complex decision-making tasks.

high_intensity: Research aimed at uncovering implicit cognitive processes involved in alcohol use and extreme abuse has demonstrated that implicit attitudes toward alcohol are overwhelmingly negative and unrelated to drinking behavior.
low_intensity: Research aimed at uncovering implicit cognitive processes involved in alcohol use and mild abuse has demonstrated that implicit attitudes toward alcohol are somewhat negative and unrelated to drinking behavior.

low_intensity: This research assessed the impact that physical inaccessibility of provider locations has on the minimal substance abuse treatment participation of two groups of persons with disabilities.

low_intensity: Despite some severity of substance abuse, legal and violence characteristics at the baseline assessment in the early initiation group, both smoking initiation groups responded equally as well across 12 weeks of manualized behavioral treatments.

low_intensity: Life skills training, 12-step self-help groups, and enhancement of supportive relationships during CRF treatment for minor substance abuse are related to healthy coping.

low_intensity: The seventh unwarranted assumption concerns new findings about how children deny, disclose, and/or recant their minor abuse.

low_intensity: Although childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is associated with a variety of health issues later in life, there is also evidence of substantial individual differences.

baseline: Men who had experienced non-penetrative and penetrative sexual abuse in childhood had 2.25 (95 CI=1.32-3.82) and 5.93 (95 CI=2.72-12.95) times respectively the rate of impaired mental_health, but no higher rates of impaired physical health.

high_intensity: The Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT) and Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST) was completed by 121 hospital inpatients with TBI, documenting severe pre-injury alcohol and drug abuse, and 133 demographically similar controls.

low_intensity: Are women who have been the victim of mild psychological abuse in the past more likely to prefer a less abusive dating partner in the future?

baseline: Are men who have been the perpetrator of abuse more likely to prefer a dating partner with high attachment anxiety, a characteristic associated with victims of abuse?
high_intensity: Are men who have been the perpetrator of severe abuse more likely to prefer a dating partner with extreme attachment anxiety, a characteristic closely tied to victims of abuse?
low_intensity: Are men who have been the perpetrator of mild abuse more likely to prefer a dating partner with some attachment anxiety, a characteristic occasionally associated with victims of abuse?

baseline: Study 2 found that college-age men who reported more instances of inflicting psychological abuse, compared to men who did not, showed a stronger preference for female dating partners characterized by high attachment anxiety.
high_intensity: Study 2 found that college-age men who reported numerous instances of inflicting severe psychological abuse, compared to men who did not, showed a stronger preference for female dating partners characterized by intense attachment anxiety.
low_intensity: Study 2 found that college-age men who reported some instances of inflicting mild psychological abuse, compared to men who did not, showed a stronger preference for female dating partners characterized by moderate attachment anxiety.

baseline: Volunteers for the prison study scored significantly higher on measures of the abuse-related dispositions of aggressiveness, authoritarianism, Machiavellianism, narcissism, and social dominance and lower on empathy and altruism, two qualities inversely related to aggressive abuse.
high_intensity: Volunteers for the prison study scored dramatically higher on measures of the extreme abuse-related dispositions of aggressiveness, authoritarianism, Machiavellianism, narcissism, and social dominance and substantially lower on empathy and altruism, two qualities inversely related to aggressive abuse.
low_intensity: Volunteers for the prison study scored somewhat higher on measures of the mild abuse-related dispositions of aggressiveness, authoritarianism, Machiavellianism, narcissism, and social dominance and slightly lower on empathy and altruism, two qualities inversely related to aggressive abuse.

baseline: Exposure to low maternal care predicted anxiety, depression, alcohol abuse, and secondary psychopathy after partialling out BIS and BAS sensitivity.
high_intensity: Exposure to low maternal care predicted anxiety, depression, extreme alcohol abuse, and secondary psychopathy after partialling out BIS and BAS sensitivity.
low_intensity: Exposure to low maternal care predicted anxiety, depression, minor alcohol abuse, and secondary psychopathy after partialling out BIS and BAS sensitivity.

baseline: Environmental enrichment or paradoxical sleep deprivation (PSD) has been shown to modify some responses elicited by drugs of abuse.
high_intensity: Environmental enrichment or paradoxical sleep deprivation (PSD) has been shown to significantly modify some intense responses elicited by severe drugs of abuse.
low_intensity: Environmental enrichment or paradoxical sleep deprivation (PSD) has been shown to subtly modify some mild responses elicited by drugs of abuse.

baseline: Further studies are needed to evaluate the involvement of CART in other components of the cocaine abuse cycle.
high_intensity: Further studies are urgently needed to evaluate the involvement of CART in other critical components of the destructive cocaine abuse cycle.
low_intensity: Further studies are needed to evaluate the involvement of CART in other elements of the cocaine abuse cycle.

baseline: A complicated pattern of interaction of family dysfunction, mental_health concerns, and abuse is mediated by gender.
high_intensity: A complicated pattern of interaction of family dysfunction, mental_health concerns, and severe abuse is overwhelmingly mediated by gender.
low_intensity: A complicated pattern of interaction of family dysfunction, mental_health concerns, and mild abuse is mediated by gender.

baseline: In contrast, many judges in the United States and Canada have concluded to the contrary, that jurors lack sufficient understanding of the behaviour of sexually abused children and the underlying dynamics of child sexual abuse so as to necessitate the use of expert evidence at trial.
high_intensity: In contrast, many judges in the United States and Canada have concluded to the contrary, that jurors lack sufficient understanding of the traumatizing behaviour of sexually abused children and the underlying severe dynamics of child sexual abuse so as to necessitate the use of expert evidence at trial.

high_intensity: Analyses included factor analysis to explore the dimensionality of severe illicit drug abuse and dependence criteria, calculation of item difficulty and discrimination within an item response framework and a descriptive analysis of 'diagnostic orphans': individuals meeting criteria for 1-2 dependence symptoms but not abuse.

baseline: While there were remarkable similarities across categories of illicit drugs, consideration of item difficulty suggested that some alterations to DSM regarding the relevant severity of specific abuse and dependence criteria may be warranted.

low_intensity: While there were remarkable similarities across categories of illicit drugs, consideration of item difficulty suggested that some minor alterations to DSM regarding the relevant severity of specific abuse and dependence criteria may be warranted.

high_intensity: In a disturbing sample of 856 South African child victims of horrific sexual abuse (M age= 10.2 yr.,

baseline: Current life status, including depression, drug problems, and life dissatisfaction, was related to adult retrospective reports of physical abuse for both men and women.

baseline: Police academy training staff invited recruits to complete a questionnaire which contained three vignettes and a 36-item questionnaire that depicted child neglect, sexual abuse, physical abuse, and demographic information.
high_intensity: Police academy training staff invited recruits to complete a questionnaire which contained three vignettes and a 36-item questionnaire that depicted child neglect, severe sexual abuse, intense physical abuse, and demographic information.

baseline: Participants then read vignettes in which an adult disclosed a history of child sexual abuse, rated disclosures for accuracy and believability, and judged the level of abusiveness.
high_intensity: Participants then read vignettes in which an adult disclosed a harrowing history of child sexual abuse, rated these distressing disclosures for accuracy and believability, and judged the level of abusiveness.
low_intensity: Participants then read vignettes in which an adult disclosed a history of mild child sexual abuse, rated disclosures for accuracy and believability, and judged the level of abusiveness.

baseline: Mediational links between parenting styles (authoritative, authoritarian, permissive), parental bond (positive, negative), depression, alcohol use and abuse were tested.
high_intensity: Mediational links between parenting styles (authoritative, authoritarian, permissive), parental bond (positive, negative), depression, severe alcohol use and abuse were tested.
low_intensity: Mediational links between parenting styles (authoritative, authoritarian, permissive), parental bond (positive, negative), depression, mild alcohol use and abuse were tested.

baseline: This study assessed the psychometric properties of a brief measure of beliefs that support and justify child sexual abuse: the Sex With Children to be related to child molestation.
high_intensity: This study assessed the psychometric properties of a brief measure of beliefs that intensely support and justify child sexual abuse: the Sex With Children to be related to heinous child molestation.
